manuscript_citation: Aw WC, Towarnicki SG, Melvin RG, Youngson NA, Garvin MR, Hu Y, Nielsen S, Thomas T, Pickford R, Bustamante S, Vila-Sanjurjo A, Smyth GK, Ballard JWO (2018) Genotype to phenotype: Diet-by-mitochondrial DNA haplotype interactions drive metabolic flexibility and organismal fitness. PLoS Genet 14(11): e1007735. doi: 10.1371/journal.pgen.1007735

steps.data: {"blocks":[{"key":"5ih4p","text":"Female third instar wandering larvae were weighed, and methanol was added to make up each sample to 20 mg\/ ml.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6espb","text":"Metabolites were extracted using an ultrasonic probe (30 s), 1 h incubation at 4\u00b0 C and then centrifugation to remove particulates","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"21na3","text":"100 \u00b5l aliquots of the supernatant were derivatised [200] before mass spectrometric interrogation with an Agilent GC\/MSD system (Agilent Technologies, CA, USA) controlled by Chemstation software.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ecqo7","text":"The GC inlet temperature was set to 230\u00b0 C. 1.0 \u00b5l of derivatised sample was injected in splitless mode, using helium as a carrier gas at constant-flow of 1.0 ml\/ min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"etm7d","text":"Chromatographic separation was performed on a 30 m SH-RXi-5Sil MS column (Shimadzu, NSW, Australia) with 0.25 mm internal diameter and 0.25 \u00b5m film thickness.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f704p","text":"The oven temperature was programmed at 70\u00b0 C for 2 min, then ramped at 15\u00b0 C\/ min to 320\u00b0 C, and held 8 min.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"50dg0","text":"Electron ionisation mass spectra were recorded at 1.4 scans\/ s over the range m\/z 50\u2013700. The MSD auxiliary temperature, source temperature, and quadrupole temperature were set to 280\u00b0 C, 230\u00b0 C, and 150\u00b0 C, respectively.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"offset":78,"length":4,"style":"italic"}],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ckjt1","text":"Analytes were identified using the NIST 2011-Wiley Mass Spectra Library. GC peaks containing mass spectra with a match quality (spectral purity) of more than 70% were considered to be tentatively identified.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26tvl","text":"No internal standard was employed. Normalisation was performed by maintaining a constant sample mass per volume.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}

{"blocks":[{"key":"29vk6","text":"Peak areas were log-transformed and statistical analysis used the limma package. Benjamini-Hochberg\u2019s correction was used to control the FDR.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":[]}],"entityMap":[]}
